pageContext.claim: “Last night I was so proud to have signed the largest Defense Bill ever. The very vital Space Force was created. New planes, ships, missiles, rockets and equipment of every kind, and all made right here in the USA. Additionally, we got Border Wall (being built) funding. Nice!”
pageContext.analysis: Adjusted for inflation, the $738 billion defense spending package Trump approved is not a record. He had requested $750 billion. Congress has refused to fund Trump's promised concrete border wall. Democrats and Republicans for years have supported renewing and upgrading the system of fences and barriers that already existed along the border. That's what Trump is now pursuing.
